snippet: A new protocol of early treatment could save many young lives.
abstract: Editorial welcomes news that the National Institutes of Health will soon sponsor clinical trials abroad to evaluate whether early and aggressive drug treatments for babies infected with HIV can effectively cure them; contends if the results are promising, treatment could spare more than 250,000 infants who are born infected each year from a lifetime of illness or costly and toxic treatments.
lead_paragraph: A new protocol of early treatment could save many young lives.

headline.main: Great Hope for Babies With H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: Great Hope for Babies With H.I.V.
